question: Today more people are travelling than ever before. Why is this the case? What are the benefits of travelling for the traveler?
text: In the olden days, travelling to another state was even a crucial task as there were no cars or taxis. Currently, a number of tourists had increased dramatically in a few decades. However, there are innumerable positive impacts of visiting.

To begin with, In the past, travelling was a hectic problem. Similarly, with the advancement of technology modes of transport began to grow exponentially. Nowadays, people can travel through cars, trains and airplanes. Moreover, it arose as a viable solution with cheap access to exhausted areas. The best illustration of the issue is, that the tourism industry of the United states of America has vigorously increased by 170 percent in only 20 years. However, according to the survey, this is the outcome of more efficient and fast air travel.

Secondly, tourism evolved with technology is one of the comprehensive approaches. Furthermore, online tickets booking or internet booking has enhanced the reputation of tourism. Hence, there are significantly greater chances of recreational activities where you can book tickets at your comfort. Additionally, because of advertisements in newspapers and social media platforms, places which were not known to many or had a blurred image due to international media are now conveniently approachable by many and the most prominent example of this is the Pakistan.

In addition, there are quite a few good benefits of leisure industry. Service industry broadens your views for learning about new cultures. Besides, this it also increases someone’s social networking and it also improves your health. Along with, this it also makes you smarter.

To conclude, undoubtedly travel is vitally increasing because of modernization in scientific technologies. As a result, travelling has become easier due to awareness of tourist destinations and aviation. Moreover, it is also gradually strengthening globe trotter relations with new cultures.
